name: sftpfs
description: An extension that provides a file manager for the SFTP protocol, designed with parallel operations and speed in mind.

viewsWelcome.contents:
Work remote with SFTP


[$(cloud) - Open SFTP Connection](command:sftpfs.connectRemote)

sftpfs.behavior.notification.upload.file.description: Show a progressive notification when a file has a size greater than the specified amount of Kilobytes, useful to know the current progress of the upload operation.

sftpfs.behavior.notification.download.fi.description: Show a progressive notification when a file has a size greater than the specified amount of Kilobytes, useful to know the current progress of the download operation.

sftpfs.cache.metadata.files.seconds.description: How long, in seconds, should file metadata be kept in the cache to improve certain operations, such as directory listing and uploading/downloading multiple files.

sftpfs.pool.passive.max.description: Maximum number of connection to open at same time, take in consideration that the SFTP server may restrict the total amount of multiple connections at same time.

sftpfs.pool.passive.min.description: Minimum amount of connection to keep in the pool for future requests, at least make it to be 1/3 of the maximum connections for better performance, for example if maximum connections is 15 set this to 5.

sftpfs.pool.passive.minIdle.description: Amount of connections to keep as idle, a connection is marked as idle when it is released after a SFTP operation, so it can be re-used for next operations without the needing of re-open the connection.

sftpfs.pool.passive.maxQueue.description: Maximum amount of requests to keep in queue if all connections are in use, we recommend to keep it as high as posible, for example 1_000_000, because extension does many operations in paralell form, so multiple acquire requests are queued at same time to perform the operation.

sftpfs.pool.passive.idleTimeoutMillis.description: Time in milliseconds to keep a connection as idle, idle connections will be closed if not are used after the timeout is reached.

sftpfs.pool.heavy.max.description: Maximum number of connection to open at same time, take in consideration that the SFTP server may restrict the total amount of multiple connections at same time.

sftpfs.pool.heavy.min.description: Minimum amount of connection to keep in the pool for future requests, at least make it to be 1/3 of the maximum connections for better performance, for example if maximum connections is 15 set this to 5.

sftpfs.pool.heavy.minIdle.description: Amount of connections to keep as idle, a connection is marked as idle when it is released after a SFTP operation, so it can be re-used for next operations without the needing of re-open the connection.

sftpfs.pool.heavy.maxQueue.description: Maximum amount of requests to keep in queue if all connections are in use, we recommend to keep it as high as posible, for example 1_000_000, because extension does many operations in paralell form, so multiple acquire requests are queued at same time to perform the operation.

sftpfs.pool.heavy.idleTimeoutMillis.description: Time in milliseconds to keep a connection as idle, idle connections will be closed if not are used after the timeout is reached.

sftpfs.workDirs.description: Used by the extension to manage working directories for remote connections.

sftpfs.remotes.description: Remote configurations, you may not require to edit this section manually (except if you want to add advanced configurations), you can use the action 'SFTP FS: Add remote...' instead.

host.description: Hostname or IP of SFTP server

port.description: Port number of the SFTP server

forceIPv4.description: Set this to true fo connect only via IPv4 address

forceIPv6.description: Set this to true fo connect only via IPv6 address

privateKey.description: Path of the private key file to use

readyTimeout.description: How long (in ms) to wait for the SSH handshake

strictVendor.description: Performs a strict server vendor check

retries.description: Number of times to retry connecting

retry_factor.description: Time factor used to calculate time between retries

remotePath.description: remote path to read, most of the cases this is configured as /

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
